results.title: Candleshoe
results.creator_credit: Norman Tokar, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: An adventure story about a noble lady and her orphans fighting to remain in their mansion after being threatened with eviction if the estate taxes are not paid. Lady St Edmund (Helen Hayes), aware of the legend about one of her ancestors supposedly having hidden a treasure of gold coins somewhere in the mansion, unwittingly finds herself a victim of a set-up by two unscrupulous characters, Bundage (Leo McKern) and Grimsworthy (Vivian Pickles), who also want to find the hidden money. Plotting and scheming the pair persuade a young urchin Casey (Jodie Foster), to help them by posing as Lady St Edmund’s long-lost granddaughter. Features David Niven as Priory, Lady St Edmund’s butler, gardener, chauffeur and right-hand man.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman Tokar, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Animation Studios

results.title: Candide Ou L'optimisme (TV Version)
results.brief_description:
He (Voltaire) is best remembered for the tale Candide (1759), a savage denunciation of metaphysical optimism (“all is for the best in the best of all possible worlds”) that reveals a world of horrors and folly. In Candide’s characters the instinct of survival remains uppermost however, and provides a ray of hope in an otherwise sombre scene. Candide at last renounces absolute truths as futile and settles for the simple life of “cultivating his garden.” Reference: Encyclopedia Britanica. Online. http://www.britanica.com

Credits: Producer, director, Pierre Cardinal ; writer, Pierre Cardinal ; photography, Jacques Lemarc ; music, Marcel Landowski.
Cast: Daniel Emilfork, Bernard Dheran, Claude Nicot, Anne Doat, Robert Vattier, Leonce Corne.

results.title: Cancer: the problem of early diagnosis (D)
results.creator_credit: American Cancer Society and Audio Productions
results.brief_description: An educational documentary looking at the disease - cancer. This film addresses the carious forms of cancer - gastric, breast, cervix, lung etc - and explains the symptoms involved with each. Employs diagrams and actual surgery footage to assist in explaining the disease. Aims to convey the message that early diagnosis and treatment is often the best prevention of cancer. Contains graphic footage of surgery.

results.title: Cancer: a research story
results.creator_credit: Larry Schwab, American Cancer Society, Dephoure Studios and Teleprograms
results.brief_description: Illustrates the story of the American Cancer Society’s basic research in cancer. This seeks to discover the causes, cures and controls of the disease. The narration is by the former Medical and Scientific Director of the Society, Dr Charles S. Cameron.

results.title: Cancer quest
results.creator_credit: American Cancer Society and Wisconsin University
results.brief_description: Through the experiences of a patient, the basic research projects being conducted at the McArdle Memorial Laboratory are depicted. The growth of normal tissue, the similarity between the growth stimulated by estrogen and the growth of cancerous tissue are shown, as is also the change from normal to cancerous as studied through azo dye effects. The effect of nutrition on cancer and the conversion of food into energy and cell structure in normal and cancer tissue is contrasted.

results.title: Cancer Institute
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Productions
results.brief_description: The Peter MacCallum hospital is one of the most advanced cancer treatment centres in the world. As well as tracing its history, this film shows aspects of work being done by various sections of the hospital.

results.title: Cancer in women
results.creator_credit: Cheryl Wright, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A self-help film designed to convince women of the need for regular physical check-ups to detect and counter early symptoms of cancer. The cost of neglect is high, and the film presents ample and convincing evidence: what is shown is strong medicine, and intentionally so— the malignant growths, the ugly scars, the excised tumours. The procedures followed in examination for cancer are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cheryl Wright, Rex Tasker and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Cancer immunology
results.brief_description: Are there truly present, on the cancer cell, antigens different from those in the normal cell, i.e.cancer- specific antigens? If present, how can they be demonstrated? Moreover, through what immunologic mechanisms, and by what factors released from the host, are cancer cells destroyed? This film attempts to answer some of these questions.

results.title: Cancer by the carton
results.creator_credit: Harry R Smith, Leston Post and International Temperance Association
results.brief_description: The relationship between cigarette-smoking and lung cancer. Leading US surgeons and health authorities emphasise the parallel between increased smoking in recent decades and higher incidence of lung cancer. Also stressed is the shorter life of cigarette-smokers. The film dramatizes the story of a (fictitious) editor, who is trying to persuade the Board of a US magazine to publish the facts on cancer. Includes scenes of an actual lung operation, and of the diseased lung after removal.

results.title: Cancer : Captain Bill Sails the 'C'
results.brief_description: An educational cartoon about cancer for children and adults, that dispels some of the myths about cancer and encourages better understanding and discussion.
